excerpts: Tofu Scramble has unadvertised eggs in it.
Register gal insists I should have asked if it had eggs.
Register gal tells me that I need to pay for what they made for me regardless of the fact that there were eggs in there on the sly.
I brought back the eggs and suggested that they have management add to the menu  that the Tofu Scramble has eggs.
The gal on the register was insistent that I was wrong and was persistently rude.
Totally bad experience, I was just trying to come up with a suitable solution (extra side of home fries) and she refused to refund me any $.
tofu scramble.author: Gina H.
tofu scramble.review:
1. Tofu Scramble has unadvertised eggs in it.
2. Register gal insists I should have asked if it had eggs.
3. Register gal tells me that I need to pay for what they made for me regardless of the fact that there were eggs in there on the sly. 
4. I paid $11 for my consolation home fries ($2.25) and free sourdough toast.


Honestly I wasn't even rude. I didn't even put up a stink. I brought back the eggs and suggested that they have management add to the menu  that the Tofu Scramble has eggs. The gal on the register was insistent that I was wrong and was persistently rude. Totally bad experience, I was just trying to come up with a suitable solution (extra side of home fries) and she refused to refund me any $. I paid $11 for the home fries and toast!

SO NOT GOING BACK, EVS!

p.s. Totally annoying world music blaring on speakers.

excerpts: I had a cheese omelette here
cheese omelette.author: Maria F.
cheese omelette.review:
The food here was decent, but I'm giving it 3 stars because of how long it took for my friend to get her order of french toast.  What was supposed to be a 10 minute wait turned into a 30 minute wait.  I guess if it turned out to be the best french toast ever it would be understandable.  I had a cheese omelette here and I liked it, but some of the potatoes that I had with my meal seemed like they weren't cooked all the way through.

The artwork on the walls is all over the place.  On one wall you have a painting of what looked like burlesque dancing girls, one of who looked like her boobs were going to pop out of her corset.  On the opposite wall there was a painting of a street in Italy (actually I'm not sure if it was supposed to be Italy, but we'll just say it was).  I would have to say that my favorite piece of art was the statue of the small sumo wrestler that was placed over the entrance door.

excerpts: I had the Spanish Omelette with home fries and wheat toast.
The best is fresh squeezed orange juice, that was sweet.
Plan to go back and try other things on the menu.
spanish omelette.author: Irene T.
spanish omelette.review: This is one great place to have brunch. So much to choose from the enormous menu.  Cafeteria style order, you get a number so you can save time not having to wait for your waiter to come by. You can choose where you want to sit. The food comes out hot. I had the Spanish Omelette with home fries and wheat toast. The best is fresh squeezed orange juice, that was sweet. Plan to go back and try other things on the menu.

excerpts: I had the Spanish omelette
but it was nothing special.
I asked for cheddar cheese but I think they used American.
spanish omelette.author: Patrick L.
spanish omelette.review:
New Year's Eve. Noon.

Me: Let's get brunch. 
Ed M: Sure. But where?
Me: Slow Club?
Ed M: Eh, I don't like anything on their menu today. How about Universal Cafe?
Me: I dunno, Yelp says it has a long wait and it looks expensive. 
Ed M: OH! HARD KNOX!
Me: Uh, I want breakfast. 
Ed M: Hm, Just For You Cafe is good but it'll be a long wait.
Me (looks up Just For You, not too pricey): OOH. BACON OMELETTE. Sure, I can wait. I've got put on my pants and socks. 
Ed M: Alright, I've got to put on my pants. 

I find it funny that half of my conversations with Ed M end up with him saying "I've got to put on my pants." 

We drive over to Just For You but it looks like it'll be a long wait. So while heading over to the backup (Slow Club)...

Ed M: Hey, I think there's this place on 25th and South Van Ness called Ann's Kitchen. Ann's something. Want to try that?
Me: Yeah, sure. 

We drive over to 25th and South Van Ness and there's no such restaurant. 

Ed M: Uh, go to 24th. 
Me: Um, nope.
Ed M: Go to 26th. 
Me: Um, nope.
Ed M: Go to Valencia. 
Me: Um, nope.
Ed M: Let me google text Ann. God, I don't remember the name of the restaurant. 
Ed M: I DON'T WANT ANN TAYLOR! Uh, how about Boogaloos?
Me: Alright. 

Of course, Boogaloos is packed at 1PM on a Saturday. ME HUNGRY!

Me: Uh, does Liberty Cafe do brunch?
Ed M: OOH! And if it's not open, Bernal seems like it would have a lot of breakfast-y type places. Lesbians love breakfast. 
Me: .....
Ed M: .....
Me: Did you just say that lesbians love breakfast?
Ed M: I have nothing to backup that statement. 

Of course, Liberty Cafe is closed. It's 2PM. I'm HUNGRY. Turns out there aren't that many breakfast-y places along Cortland Ave. We do spot Moonlight Cafe. It's a gamble. There's an odd feeling with going into a restaurant that you haven't pre-Yelped. Like trying a new drink. Or sleeping with a "new" hooker. 

There's nothing really special about Moonlight Cafe. Bagels, omelettes, bagels, and sandwiches with a chalkboard menu. It's LOUD inside because of all the kids and the radio that's turned up to full blast. I had the Spanish omelette but it was nothing special. I asked for cheddar cheese but I think they used American. Oh yeah, it's cash only. 

Should have gone to Slow Club.

excerpts: Try the Mediterranean platter, gyro, eggs Benedict, and all of the sandwiches.
eggs benedict.author: Alex F.
eggs benedict.review:
Great tasty fresh food! Solid breakfast options depending on your mood. 
Try the Mediterranean platter, gyro, eggs Benedict, and all of the sandwiches.

excerpts: I'm sure they are all really good, but I did eye somebody that ordered the Eggs Benedict.
eggs benedict.author: Joy A.
eggs benedict.review:
Awesome, friendly service every time we eat here.  Lots of locals and familiar faces come here.  I don't blame them for coming back because their service and food are pretty good.

If there for breakfast, a must try is their "fresh lox and the works". They spread cream cheese, a thin layer of fresh salmon, a handful of capers.. all nicely topped on a lightly toasted asiago bagel. It comes w/ slices of lettuce and tomato on the side.  Tastes really good w/ their coffee... nice & strong.  

Whether for breakfast, brunch, or lunch their Chicken Pesto Crepe is pure goodness. It's filled w/ mushrooms, tomatoes, onions, and provolone cheese... comes w/ seasoned potatoes and a lightly dressed salad.  Nice hearty meal at any time of the day.

If there for lunch, you should never leave without ordering their "sweet" crepe. I usually opt for their combo- banana, nutella, & strawberry. ((Sigh)) It's really good... 

There are other breakfast & lunch items on the menu that I haven't tried yet.  I'm sure they are all really good, but I did eye somebody that ordered the Eggs Benedict.  Ooooo, for the next breakfast visit....

Location: street parking is available, but again metered. Bring change. Streets in the neighborhood are narrow as well, so be prepared for that when driving around for parking.

excerpts: The eggs benedict was perfect and the hollandaise sauce wasn't runny.
eggs benedict.author: Tony L.
eggs benedict.review: For an unseasonably beautiful November morning here in San Francisco, it was time to dine al fresco for Sunday breakfast.  My dad thinks it's the "Earthquake Weather," but who's checking.  I drove up Cortland Ave. in Bernal Heights and used my parking karma on a spot near St. Kevin's Church.  How lucky!  The place is full of locals, families, some out of towners...good vibe.  The eggs benedict was perfect and the hollandaise sauce wasn't runny.  The potatoes were brown and not burnt and was served timely.  Only the coffee wasn't up the snuff; I would suggest going across the street for a bold cup.  The joint is family owned and the crowd is what you would expect in this neighborhood (very neighborly).  I am not bashing the Visitacion Valley folk in my 'hood, but this was a very nice place to have breakfast on a warm Sunday morning.  It's family friendly, too. I will be back.

excerpts: Today, I discovered that the Eggs Benedict does not come with toast--never mind the fact that it is on the menu immediately above the words "all breakfasts above are served with potatoes and toast.
I first mentioned this to the guy that had place my plate on the counter, but he told m that the Eggs Benedict doesn't come with toast.
Manager / owner guy was at the counter, and I asked him why it doesn't come with toast when, according to the menu, it clearly does.
He said that the biscuits that are part of the Eggs Benedict counted as toast.
What?
I told him that I disagreed
and I felt like I was owed some toast.
He asked me what kind of toast I wanted, I told him rye.
Then, when the toast came he attempted to charge me $1.75 for the toast.
eggs benedict.author: David L.
eggs benedict.review:
I've eaten here a few times.  The place has fairly good breakfast, it's a bit over priced, but was willing to forgo that because it is so close to my house.  

Today, I discovered that the Eggs Benedict does not come with toast--never mind the fact that it is on the menu immediately above the words "all breakfasts above are served with potatoes and toast."  I first mentioned this to the guy that had place my plate on the counter, but he told m that the Eggs Benedict doesn't come with toast.  Manager / owner guy was at the counter, and I asked him why it doesn't come with toast when, according to the menu, it clearly does.   He said that the biscuits that are part of the Eggs Benedict counted as toast.  What?  I told him that I disagreed and I felt like I was owed some toast.  He asked me what kind of toast I wanted, I told him rye.  Then, when the toast came he attempted to charge me $1.75 for the toast.   I refused on principal.

I'm not going to cry over toast, but I am going to complain at the manager guy's terrible customer service.  For the two cents the toast cost him and a menu that was corrected the next time I ate there, he could have earned a loyal customer.  Instead, he earned this review and has lost a customer.

excerpts: I love the Healthy Start breakfast.
The Ginger or Lavender Lemonade is a real treat.
Check out the after hours venue.
Tuesdays Child on Wednesdays..
The 3rd Wednesday evening of the month for local standup comedy, spoken word and music created by Sams son Azziz.
Fantastic.
healthy start.author: Jeanne J.
healthy start.review:
Great Family Business. 
Sam and family have fresh healthy breakfasts and lunches. I love the Healthy Start breakfast. The Ginger or Lavender Lemonade is a real treat. Check out the after hours venue. Tuesdays Child on Wednesdays.. The 3rd Wednesday evening of the month for local standup comedy, spoken word and music created by Sams son Azziz.  Fantastic.

excerpts: I had their healthy start breakfast, which looked real good on the counter (waiting to be served.)
healthy start.author: Fannie S.
healthy start.review:
Freshly squeezed OJ in frosty mugs? Yes, please!  I wanted to order more! 

I had their healthy start breakfast, which looked real good on the counter (waiting to be served.)  It's  two poached eggs with avocado spread on an english muffin (they need to drain the water out, because the english muffin was a mushy mess), but it was otherwise quite delicious.  I ordered a side of sausage, which was good too.  

Prices = reasonable.

Service = friendly. Order at the counter, grab a number and table, and wait for them to bring everything.  

I'll be back here when I'm in the area.

excerpts: We all had the healthy start:  two poached eggs served over a toasted english muffin topped with avocado and fresh salsa.
served with a side salad.
Really tasty and satisfying.
I don't usually make the trek out to Bernal, but this was fun.
Lost a star for having a pretty dingy interior.
healthy start.author: Eliza D.
healthy start.review: This place reminds me a lot of Crepevine. Standard breakfasty/brunch food. We all had the healthy start:  two poached eggs served over a toasted english muffin topped with avocado and fresh salsa. served with a side salad. Really tasty and satisfying. I don't usually make the trek out to Bernal, but this was fun. Lost a star for having a pretty dingy interior.

excerpts: Highlights include the healthy start, the veggie sandwich, any crepe, and potatoes.
Iced coffee is cold pressed and amazing.
Really you cannot go wrong with anything.
healthy start.author: Josh T.
healthy start.review: Super consistent brunch place. Always good food. No pizzazz needed. Really friendly staff. Lots of vegetarian options. Highlights include the healthy start, the veggie sandwich, any crepe, and potatoes. Iced coffee is cold pressed and amazing. Really you cannot go wrong with anything.

excerpts: I've their healthy start on the memo.
Their bacon is that the kind with thick cut.
I like to go there on the weekend with my dog.
Wish they have outdoor heater though, because you know it could be kinda chilly in bernal sometime.
healthy start.author: Yina M.
healthy start.review: Moonlight cafe has changed over the years! I really enjoy going there now. The food is very fresh and well made. The juices are freshly squeezed. Yes, they have carrot and orange juice. Both are great. I've their healthy start on the memo. Their bacon is that the kind with thick cut. I like to go there on the weekend with my dog. Wish they have outdoor heater though, because you know it could be kinda chilly in bernal sometime. :)

excerpts: All I have to say is get the Healthy Start breakfast and a glass of lavender lemonade.
healthy start.author: T J.
healthy start.review: All I have to say is get the Healthy Start breakfast and a glass of lavender lemonade.

excerpts: I ordered a western scramble with gf toast and potatoes
and it was really good
(the toast actually tasted like bread)!
Super convenient to people near Bernal as it's right on Cortland.
And then you can go work off the food with your dog across the street at fit bernal fit.
western scramble.author: T P.
western scramble.review: Gluten free bread (and bagels, and English muffins)! It makes me so happy! Super solid brunch foods and friendly staff. I ordered a western scramble with gf toast and potatoes and it was really good (the toast actually tasted like bread)! Super convenient to people near Bernal as it's right on Cortland. And then you can go work off the food with your dog across the street at fit bernal fit. :)

excerpts: I ordered the Western Scramble.
Then I proceeded to wait  20 mins for my food..
When it was delivered.....
The eggs were OK... scrambled with Chicken Sausage, onions, tomatoes, and bell peppers.
They were served with Toast and Hash Browns (which I was REALLY hungry for).......
The Hash Browns SUCKED!!!
western scramble.author: Bryan M.
western scramble.review: So.. I was stumbling around Bernal Heights today... doing yard sales in a neighborhood I am usually not in.. I got hungry... and saw the Moonlight Cafe.  It was busy... which is usually a good sign.... so I went in.... The menu seemed to have a good breakfast.  I ordered the Western Scramble.  Then I proceeded to wait  20 mins for my food..  When it was delivered..... The eggs were OK... scrambled with Chicken Sausage, onions, tomatoes, and bell peppers.  They were served with Toast and Hash Browns (which I was REALLY hungry for).......  The Hash Browns SUCKED!!!  They were barely cooked cubes of potatoes. still CRUNCHY!  I took my plate back, and the guy was like.... 'Sorry!... No problem..! ' And put another steaming helping of UNDERDONE potatoes on my plate!!!!!  NOTE TO YOUR COOK:  Hash Browns are supported to be BROWNED!!! .. on every side of the potato cube!  Steamy white potato cubes DO NOT make HASH  BROWNS!!  If you can't figure out this IMPORTANT breakfast side dish... Why the HELL are you serving breakfast?  AND.... The TOAST was not TOASTED!!!...  Guess I stopped at the WRONG place!!  Won't make that mistake again....!!!!

excerpts: Try the Bernal Hill omelette - you will not be disappointed!
bernal hill omelette.author: E B.
bernal hill omelette.review: I love Moonlight Cafe and eat there weekly. It's a great neighborhood place, with friendly owners. I am a regular and they always remember how I like my iced tea - which is the delicious by the way. Great food, great location, nice owners & a super casual setting. Try the Bernal Hill omelette - you will not be disappointed!

excerpts: While I have not explored too much of the menu, I have identified a staple item that I look forward to every Sunday morning (hangover or not)...the "breakfast in a pocket".
The concept is simple - regular white pita, soft and supple (oooh, i really hate using that word, but it's necessary here) stuffed with eggs scrambled with your choice of bacon or sausage and cheese.
I personally go for the bacon with cheddar...and then go the extra mile
that's right...
the SIDE OF CREAM CHEESE.
(Damn, I am salivating)

The folks there save me the pang of greed I feel when ordering my sinful side, and just include it next to my
perfect pocket everytime
I order.
Yet another reason to love the moonlight cafe.
Always kind, consistently yummy, and great neighborhood atmosphere.
My only hesitation in filling that fifth star is that their only available hot sauce is Tabasco...would much prefer Tapatio.
breakfast in a pocket.author: Jessa B.
breakfast in a pocket.review:
Moonlight cafe is everyhing I want and need on a Sunday morning. While I have not explored too much of the menu, I have identified a staple item that I look forward to every Sunday morning (hangover or not)...the "breakfast in a pocket". The concept is simple - regular white pita, soft and supple (oooh, i really hate using that word, but it's necessary here) stuffed with eggs scrambled with your choice of bacon or sausage and cheese. I personally go for the bacon with cheddar...and then go the extra mile...that's right...the SIDE OF CREAM CHEESE. (Damn, I am salivating) The folks there save me the pang of greed I feel when ordering my sinful side, and just include it next to my
perfect pocket everytime I order. Yet another reason to love the moonlight cafe. Always kind, consistently yummy, and great neighborhood atmosphere. My only hesitation in filling that fifth star is that their only available hot sauce is Tabasco...would much prefer Tapatio.

excerpts: and I go religiously each weekend for their short stack of pancakes and coffee.
I disagree with others about the coffee review.
I love their espresso and find the neighboring martha's to be rather bitter.
The service is friendly - I'm always greeted warmly by staff and the server knows me by name.
I recommend the pancakes (obviously) and also their BLT is great!
I think their crepes are essentially the same as crepevine, or others like that.
I'm not a big crepe fan
so don't really have much to say on that.
short stack of pancakes.author: Suzi S.
short stack of pancakes.review: I love this place! It is two blocks from my house and I go religiously each weekend for their short stack of pancakes and coffee. I disagree with others about the coffee review. I love their espresso and find the neighboring martha's to be rather bitter. The service is friendly - I'm always greeted warmly by staff and the server knows me by name. I recommend the pancakes (obviously) and also their BLT is great! I think their crepes are essentially the same as crepevine, or others like that. I'm not a big crepe fan so don't really have much to say on that.

excerpts: My friend and I actually really wanted to try the waffles with poached eggs at Suite foods waffle shop but they are closed till the 14th.
The staff here is super friendly and you order at the counter and sit down
and they bring you your food.
I order a Basilico crepe, which has basil, provolone, tomatoes and onions.
waffles.author: Sam W.
waffles.review:
I stumbled here after picking up some pickles at Paulie's Pickling down the street. My friend and I actually really wanted to try the waffles with poached eggs at Suite foods waffle shop but they are closed till the 14th. The staff here is super friendly and you order at the counter and sit down and they bring you your food. I order a Basilico crepe, which has basil, provolone, tomatoes and onions. My friend had the egg, ham and cheese sandwich on a croissant. 

My crepe was very good. It came with a side of salad and some home fries. The salad was very fresh and the potatoes good as well. I'm a huge crepe fiend so any time I can have them, I'm happy. I tried my friend's sandwich and it was very tasty. The croissant was so buttery. All in all, a very good spot to stop by for a crepe lunch. I should also mention they have a lot of other food on the menu besides crepes. Burgers, sandwiches, baked goods, etc. We also had mango iced tea and fresh squeezed oj and both were great.

excerpts: Bagels, pancakes, waffles, and French toast are all tasty too.
waffles.author: Meredith D.
waffles.review:
I love this place for a reasonably-priced breakfast -- the croissant sandwich always hits the spot. Bagels, pancakes, waffles, and French toast are all tasty too. And the fresh-squeezed orange juice in a frosty mug rounds it off perfectly.

Best of all, the staff is super friendly.

excerpts: I got the combo #2.
It has 2 pancakes, eggs, and choice of sausage or bacon.
combo.author: Junella T.
combo.review:
Great neighborhood spot. Easy menu. Easy parking. 

Came here for brunch around 10am and it wasn't busy at all. The menu is very limited for breakfast but simplicity makes it easier to pick. They also serve sandwiches, crepes, wraps, and soups along with espresso drinks. The menu is written on a chalkboard and you order before sitting down. 

I got the combo #2. It has 2 pancakes, eggs, and choice of sausage or bacon. The presentation is simple, but the food is good. 

Def will come back and check out their burgers and lunch!

excerpts: Yummy Combo Crepe: fresh strawberries, bananas, Nutella AND whipped cream.
The staff: friendly and fun.
I was here at 8am so it wasn't crowed and the vibe was mellow.
Definitely will come back to try the rest of the crepes.
combo.author: pip t.
combo.review: Yummy Combo Crepe: fresh strawberries, bananas, Nutella AND whipped cream. The staff: friendly and fun. I was here at 8am so it wasn't crowed and the vibe was mellow. Definitely will come back to try the rest of the crepes.

excerpts: I like the combo with french toast, bacon, and eggs - will leave you full all morning.
You can also come on a Wednesday night for a comedy show (happens once per month)!
combo.author: Jessica K.
combo.review: Classic spot in Bernal with the nicest people. Great outdoor tables where you can enjoy the sun and the best neighborhood in SF! Most of their specialties are breakfast-focused, and some solid crepe options to choose from. I like the combo with french toast, bacon, and eggs - will leave you full all morning. You can also come on a Wednesday night for a comedy show (happens once per month)!

excerpts: I ordered an iced coffee and a "Combo crepe" which included strawberries, bananas, and Nutella.
Both turned out to be around $13 so I would say for San Francisco, that's average.
My food was prepared in a timely manner, it didn't seem incredibly busy when I walked in so it only took around 5 mins to arrive at my table.
The crepe was pretty good!
With fresh fruits and chocolate drizzle, it's really difficult to mess up a Nutella crepe.
The iced coffee was a smooth and bold cold brew, so no complaints there.
It's also served in a chilled glass which was a very nice touch!
Not really sure where all the bad reviews are coming from, I really enjoyed my experience here.
Customer service was great, food was prepared quickly, and most importantly there was seating available!!
combo.author: Tricia Angela L.
combo.review:
I was staying at a friend's house and thought I'd walk over to Cortland to grab breakfast while my friend was at work. I stumbled across Moonlight Cafe and thought I'd check it out since they had a pretty large menu and outdoor seating (it was a really nice day). 
I ordered an iced coffee and a "Combo crepe" which included strawberries, bananas, and Nutella. Both turned out to be around $13 so I would say for San Francisco, that's average. 
My food was prepared in a timely manner, it didn't seem incredibly busy when I walked in so it only took around 5 mins to arrive at my table. The crepe was pretty good! With fresh fruits and chocolate drizzle, it's really difficult to mess up a Nutella crepe. The iced coffee was a smooth and bold cold brew, so no complaints there. It's also served in a chilled glass which was a very nice touch! 
Not really sure where all the bad reviews are coming from, I really enjoyed my experience here. Customer service was great, food was prepared quickly, and most importantly there was seating available!!

excerpts: I got the breakfast combo and the eggs were yummy.
I highly recommend this place.
Good people, good pancakes!
combo.author: Jessie M.
combo.review: We just ate here and it was sooo yummy! The owner was really nice and hilarious! I got the breakfast combo and the eggs were yummy. I highly recommend this place. Good people, good pancakes! :)

excerpts: and they were friendly enough but the breakfast combo's are not to my liking
combo.author: Kim R.
combo.review:
I tried to go here last weekend for breakfast and I stopped at Martha's 
coffee first. and thenwalked accross the street. The owner was very rude and went on about how they do not allow any outside products that are not purchased there and I would need to put it in a cup right 
away.

I understand you can't hack the competition there coffee is way better then yours that's a given.

It's the way that you ask be a little more friendly in the way you ask instead of Hostile. Due to this fact I will not be coming back ..But I will walk past ur shop with my Martha Brother's and maybe I will even linger at the corner for a bit.

If the food was great maybe I would not care that you have no manners. But it's not so whatever I can spend my money elsewhere.

Plus I tried the food 2wice (check reviews below)

 I have been here b4 to eat breakfast it was okay and they were friendly enough but the breakfast combo's are not to my liking and it's not easy to substitute

I also have had the cheesesteak here it's okay but does not compare to the cheesesteak shops at all

excerpts: The moonlight cafe has one of the best burger/fries combo's i have ever had in the City.
It's not a burger joint at all
and they don't try to be one, but the nonchalant burger entry on the menu is so scrumptious that you have to appreciate the time and effort they put into ALL their food.
This is my favorite place to go in Bernal and it is a good prequel to a Maggie Mudd's shake or sundae.
combo.author: Curran M.
combo.review:
The moonlight cafe has one of the best burger/fries combo's i have ever had in the City. It's not a burger joint at all and they don't try to be one, but the nonchalant burger entry on the menu is so scrumptious that you have to appreciate the time and effort they put into ALL their food. This is my favorite place to go in Bernal and it is a good prequel to a Maggie Mudd's shake or sundae. Minus one star for no soda fountain.

post script:  I also love the murals on the walls. so pretty.

excerpts: We got two sandwiches and the combo crepe (nutella, strawberries, and bananas).
The grilled ham and cheese and the tuna sandwich were both very yummy and satisfying.
combo.author: Mary K.
combo.review:
We got two sandwiches and the combo crepe (nutella, strawberries, and bananas).  The grilled ham and cheese and the tuna sandwich were both very yummy and satisfying.  The crepe at the end was good.

I felt like the prices were just a bit high.  Otherwise, I'd go with 5 stars.

excerpts: They offers salads, vegetarian friendly dishes, crepes (savory or sweet), scrambles, omelettes, sandwiches, burgers, bagels, sides (their house potatoes are my favorite), breakfast combos, coffees, teas, juices, smoothies, you name it.
Restroom for customers is always clean.
Fun music playing throughout the day.
There is plenty of seating inside or if you'd like you can sit outside and take in the fresh air.
I love bringing my family and friends here when they visit me.
They always leave happy and full.
Highly recommend this place!
potatoes.author: Cristal F.
potatoes.review: Amazing cafe in the Bernal Heights neighborhood. I love coming here because the service is great and food always comes out fast and delicious. They have an extensive menu. They offers salads, vegetarian friendly dishes, crepes (savory or sweet), scrambles, omelettes, sandwiches, burgers, bagels, sides (their house potatoes are my favorite), breakfast combos, coffees, teas, juices, smoothies, you name it. Restroom for customers is always clean. Fun music playing throughout the day. There is plenty of seating inside or if you'd like you can sit outside and take in the fresh air. I love bringing my family and friends here when they visit me. They always leave happy and full. Highly recommend this place!

excerpts: I ordered a western scramble with gf toast and potatoes
and it was really good
(the toast actually tasted like bread)!
Super convenient to people near Bernal as it's right on Cortland.
And then you can go work off the food with your dog across the street at fit bernal fit.
potatoes.author: T P.
potatoes.review: Gluten free bread (and bagels, and English muffins)! It makes me so happy! Super solid brunch foods and friendly staff. I ordered a western scramble with gf toast and potatoes and it was really good (the toast actually tasted like bread)! Super convenient to people near Bernal as it's right on Cortland. And then you can go work off the food with your dog across the street at fit bernal fit. :)

excerpts: The salad was very fresh and the potatoes good as well.
I'm a huge crepe fiend
so any time I can have them
, I'm happy.
I tried my friend's sandwich and it was very tasty.
The croissant was so buttery.
All in all, a very good spot to stop by for a crepe lunch.
I should also mention they have a lot of other food on the menu besides crepes.
Burgers, sandwiches, baked goods, etc.
We also had mango iced tea and fresh squeezed oj and both were great.
potatoes.author: Sam W.
potatoes.review:
I stumbled here after picking up some pickles at Paulie's Pickling down the street. My friend and I actually really wanted to try the waffles with poached eggs at Suite foods waffle shop but they are closed till the 14th. The staff here is super friendly and you order at the counter and sit down and they bring you your food. I order a Basilico crepe, which has basil, provolone, tomatoes and onions. My friend had the egg, ham and cheese sandwich on a croissant. 

My crepe was very good. It came with a side of salad and some home fries. The salad was very fresh and the potatoes good as well. I'm a huge crepe fiend so any time I can have them, I'm happy. I tried my friend's sandwich and it was very tasty. The croissant was so buttery. All in all, a very good spot to stop by for a crepe lunch. I should also mention they have a lot of other food on the menu besides crepes. Burgers, sandwiches, baked goods, etc. We also had mango iced tea and fresh squeezed oj and both were great.

excerpts: The hash potatoes were yumz.
potatoes.author: Margaret R.
potatoes.review:
I got the healthy starter. MMmmmmm... It consisted of two poached eggs on an english muffin. A delicious, fresh made salsa was sprinkled on top of the poached eggs. It also came with a small salad. The dish tasted light and flavorful. I would have liked more salsa! 

I also tried the smoked salmon crepe. It tasted a bit too fishy for me, but it still had a nice flavor to it. The hash potatoes were yumz.

The hot apple cider was ehh...Just something similar to the mix you get at the store.

excerpts: Highlights include the healthy start, the veggie sandwich, any crepe, and potatoes.
Iced coffee is cold pressed and amazing.
Really you cannot go wrong with anything.
potatoes.author: Josh T.
potatoes.review: Super consistent brunch place. Always good food. No pizzazz needed. Really friendly staff. Lots of vegetarian options. Highlights include the healthy start, the veggie sandwich, any crepe, and potatoes. Iced coffee is cold pressed and amazing. Really you cannot go wrong with anything.

excerpts: It's filled w/ mushrooms, tomatoes, onions, and provolone cheese... comes w/ seasoned potatoes and a lightly dressed salad.
potatoes.author: Joy A.
potatoes.review:
Awesome, friendly service every time we eat here.  Lots of locals and familiar faces come here.  I don't blame them for coming back because their service and food are pretty good.

If there for breakfast, a must try is their "fresh lox and the works". They spread cream cheese, a thin layer of fresh salmon, a handful of capers.. all nicely topped on a lightly toasted asiago bagel. It comes w/ slices of lettuce and tomato on the side.  Tastes really good w/ their coffee... nice & strong.  

Whether for breakfast, brunch, or lunch their Chicken Pesto Crepe is pure goodness. It's filled w/ mushrooms, tomatoes, onions, and provolone cheese... comes w/ seasoned potatoes and a lightly dressed salad.  Nice hearty meal at any time of the day.

If there for lunch, you should never leave without ordering their "sweet" crepe. I usually opt for their combo- banana, nutella, & strawberry. ((Sigh)) It's really good... 

There are other breakfast & lunch items on the menu that I haven't tried yet.  I'm sure they are all really good, but I did eye somebody that ordered the Eggs Benedict.  Ooooo, for the next breakfast visit....

Location: street parking is available, but again metered. Bring change. Streets in the neighborhood are narrow as well, so be prepared for that when driving around for parking.

excerpts: I got a simple breakfast of French toast, scrambled eggs, potatoes, and sausage links
and they were all the best I've ever had!!
I used to work at a few breakfast joints and I hate French tost, but *this* french toast had me coming back for thirds ;)
Its how I remember French Toast as a kid except probably with less butter.
(I had a butter addiction as a kid, I'm way better now!
Well, kind of better)
They put sage or something
*spectacular* in the potatoes and the sausage has rosemary...although the breakfast I had was simple, I fell in love with it.
potatoes.author: Jessi K.
potatoes.review:
I haven't written a review in eons, but after the third time here I knew I had to come back on leave a rave review!  So here goes:

I loved this place soooooo much!!  I so wish I lived closer, I'd be here every day!

Why only 4 stars?  Because I actually haven't had much off the menu.  My husband was the more adventurous one, and got something different every time we came, but he's not a yelper.  But I can say this, every time I've been here I got a simple breakfast of French toast, scrambled eggs, potatoes, and sausage links  and they were all the best I've ever had!!  I used to work at a few breakfast joints and I hate French tost, but *this* french toast had me coming back for thirds ;)  Its how I remember French Toast as a kid except probably with less butter.  (I had a butter addiction as a kid, I'm way better now!  Well, kind of better)  They put sage or something *spectacular* in the potatoes and the sausage has rosemary...although the breakfast I had was simple, I fell in love with it.  Now for the best part:

The BEST drip coffee I've EVER had at a restaurant EVER!!!!!  ANd the Mango Smoothies...OMG.  I would come here every day and get coffee and a smoothie if I lived closer.  

Lets see...out of all the the Breakfast places that I have reviewed, I think this one might be my favorite based on the fact that the smoothies and coffee are so good, I have not been disappointed in the one breakfast I've tried, and there's always seating, even outdoor seating if we have the dog with us.  

If I think of it, I'll totally write another review after I broaden what I order here.  

Also, I can't forget, I really liked the staff, the service seemed speedy (although you do order at the counter, they bring you your food and they're pretty attentive to what you might need).  

Again, loved this place sooooooo much!!!

excerpts: The potatoes are OK, but would be better with some spice or veggies thrown in.
potatoes.author: Michael M.
potatoes.review:
In my continuing quest of my new neighborhood, I decided to trek up the hill a bit and hit this cafe.

The service couldn't be better.  Order at the counter, make sure you get a big mug of coffee, and have a seat.  You will wait longer for your food than most places, but that's OK ... everybody seems to just want to relax. A bit pricier than I expected.

I had a scramble with chicken apple sausage, onions, peppers and tomato.  It was pretty good, but I could have done better at home.  The potatoes are OK, but would be better with some spice or veggies thrown in.

Other items on the menu include omelets, bagels, breakfast sandwiches, pancakes, etc.  The coffee was good and better than Martha Brothers and Progressive Grounds.

It was a good, family oriented place where everybody seems to know everybody else ... just what you would expect to find in a neighborhood dive.  I'll be back now and then to try other things.

excerpts: The potatoes were good.
IT's a place I wouldn't go out my way to go back to.
potatoes.author: Ayana K.
potatoes.review: Cool place on Cortland. It's next to my nail shop so my daughter and I decided to go here. My daughter got the Pancake breakfast which was just ok. I got a spinach, tomato & mushroom omelet. It lacked seasoning. The potatoes were good. IT's a place I wouldn't go out my way to go back to.

excerpts: Perfect place to bring the kids - no whining when they've got all their favorites to pick from like pancakes, cheese crepes, burgers & fries and eggs with potatoes.
potatoes.author: Molly T.
potatoes.review:
Every neighborhood needs one of these places - crepes, good sandwiches, burgers, salads and some mediterrean food thrown in.  Moonlight Cafe does an exceptionally good job at this particular genre.  I loves me some basil crepes and fresh cooked taters. 

Perfect place to bring the kids - no whining when they've got all their favorites to pick from like pancakes, cheese crepes, burgers & fries and eggs with potatoes.  

It's always a good sign too, when you recognize the same employees for years - means that management is probably cool and treats their people well.  

My only complaint - they never give you enough butter.  Sorry, but I like my toast BUTTERY!  You need to toss me AT LEAST four of those little wax paper butter squares.

excerpts: They were barely cooked cubes of potatoes.
still CRUNCHY!
I took my plate back, and the guy was like.... 'Sorry!...
No problem..! '
And put another steaming helping of UNDERDONE potatoes on my plate!!!!!
NOTE TO YOUR COOK:
Hash Browns are supported to be BROWNED!!!
.. on every side of the potato cube!
Steamy white potato cubes DO NOT make HASH  BROWNS!!
If you can't figure out this IMPORTANT breakfast side dish...
Why the HELL are you serving breakfast?
AND....
The TOAST was not TOASTED!!!
Guess
I stopped at the WRONG place!!
Won't make that mistake again....!!!!
potatoes.author: Bryan M.
potatoes.review: So.. I was stumbling around Bernal Heights today... doing yard sales in a neighborhood I am usually not in.. I got hungry... and saw the Moonlight Cafe.  It was busy... which is usually a good sign.... so I went in.... The menu seemed to have a good breakfast.  I ordered the Western Scramble.  Then I proceeded to wait  20 mins for my food..  When it was delivered..... The eggs were OK... scrambled with Chicken Sausage, onions, tomatoes, and bell peppers.  They were served with Toast and Hash Browns (which I was REALLY hungry for).......  The Hash Browns SUCKED!!!  They were barely cooked cubes of potatoes. still CRUNCHY!  I took my plate back, and the guy was like.... 'Sorry!... No problem..! ' And put another steaming helping of UNDERDONE potatoes on my plate!!!!!  NOTE TO YOUR COOK:  Hash Browns are supported to be BROWNED!!! .. on every side of the potato cube!  Steamy white potato cubes DO NOT make HASH  BROWNS!!  If you can't figure out this IMPORTANT breakfast side dish... Why the HELL are you serving breakfast?  AND.... The TOAST was not TOASTED!!!...  Guess I stopped at the WRONG place!!  Won't make that mistake again....!!!!

excerpts: My crepe came with potatoes AND a salad.
My husband's french toast smelled really good!
and there were 6 pieces!
The orange juice tasted fresh and the coffee tasted decent, not too strong and not too light.
potatoes.author: Caroline C.
potatoes.review:
3.5 stars...

I'd been here twice before the remodel and each time I went, there was a hair in my food. Each time! I vowed never to go back. 
But it's been a while since the remodel, and I am a forgiving person, believe it or not. And my parents run a restaurant, and I know how hard it is. SO, I decided to give this place another try. My husband was very proud of me. 

I ordered the Mediterranean crepe and my husband ordered the french toast with the walnut bread. Two cups of coffee and an orange juice. 

The food was good. My crepe came with potatoes AND a salad. My husband's french toast smelled really good! and there were 6 pieces! The orange juice tasted fresh and the coffee tasted decent, not too strong and not too light. The wait  for our food was a bit long, though. 

This place is a do-it-yourself service. Order at the counter, pick up your utensils and condiments, seat yourself. They call your number and you pick it up. 

There are a lot of tables inside. Good place for small to mid-sized groups and kids. Two tables outside. 

We'll probably be back. It's the only place near by that does the crepe/omelet/pancakes/french toast thing, that doesn't cost an arm and a leg. 

Total bill: about $22.00 with tax and tip

excerpts: and I liked it, but some of the potatoes that I had with my meal seemed like they weren't cooked all the way through.
potatoes.author: Maria F.
potatoes.review:
The food here was decent, but I'm giving it 3 stars because of how long it took for my friend to get her order of french toast.  What was supposed to be a 10 minute wait turned into a 30 minute wait.  I guess if it turned out to be the best french toast ever it would be understandable.  I had a cheese omelette here and I liked it, but some of the potatoes that I had with my meal seemed like they weren't cooked all the way through.

The artwork on the walls is all over the place.  On one wall you have a painting of what looked like burlesque dancing girls, one of who looked like her boobs were going to pop out of her corset.  On the opposite wall there was a painting of a street in Italy (actually I'm not sure if it was supposed to be Italy, but we'll just say it was).  I would have to say that my favorite piece of art was the statue of the small sumo wrestler that was placed over the entrance door.

excerpts: Potatoes + toast completed my meal-
a fine greasy feast-
and my partner was reasonably happy w/his chicken/pinenuts/provolone crepe.
$6 for mine, $9 for his.
potatoes.author: Zoe L.
potatoes.review:
At 3pm on a Sunday, this is the only place you can get food along this stretch of Cortland, which automatically earns it a star.  Breakfast all day gets it another star.  And then a third star b/c we didn't hate the food.  It was pretty quiet when we went in- no line, lots of empty tables to choose from.  My scrambled egg whites weren't exactly scrambled; more of like a fried egg white chopped into small squares.  Not the end of the world.  Potatoes + toast completed my meal- a fine greasy feast- and my partner was reasonably happy w/his chicken/pinenuts/provolone crepe.  $6 for mine, $9 for his.  Plenty of available street parking.

This place strikes me as a smaller, rougher-edged version of Crepes on Cole- menu is pretty similar, and it's also CASH ONLY.

excerpts: I ordered pancakes with a side of potatoes with a cup of coffee.
The pancakes were fluffy and not too big and a very generous portion of seasoned, red potatoes, which were flavorful.
The coffee was strong, which is exactly what I needed.
The service was friendly and you get your money's worth with the portions of food being generous and the prices reasonable.
potatoes.author: Carlos C.
potatoes.review: I had gone by this place many times and after being done with a standing morning appointment,  in the neighborhood, I decided to have a late breakfast here.  I ordered pancakes with a side of potatoes with a cup of coffee.  The pancakes were fluffy and not too big and a very generous portion of seasoned, red potatoes, which were flavorful.  The coffee was strong, which is exactly what I needed.  The service was friendly and you get your money's worth with the portions of food being generous and the prices reasonable.

excerpts: I want my potatoes to be crispy and flavorful.
My spanish omelet was just okay- not something that I couldn't do myself with random fridge items & the potatoes seemed bland.
potatoes.author: Chrissy L.
potatoes.review: For breakfast this place just seemed average. If I pay $9 (cash) for an omelet, I want it to be damn tasty. I want my potatoes to be crispy and flavorful. My spanish omelet was just okay- not something that I couldn't do myself with random fridge items & the potatoes seemed bland.

excerpts: The potatoes are kickin', and the salad though a bit tart is pretty good and healthy.
Love the ice tea ... but a refill should be in order.
Not too busy and on hot days the windows open and sidewalk seating is the norm....
thanks Moonlight for being clean, comfortable, and A-OK!
potatoes.author: Mark B.
potatoes.review: A nice little place to get some crepes .... though they taste more like a thin omelet. The potatoes are kickin', and the salad though a bit tart is pretty good and healthy.  Love the ice tea ... but a refill should be in order. Not too busy and on hot days the windows open and sidewalk seating is the norm.... thanks Moonlight for being clean, comfortable, and A-OK!

excerpts: The potatoes were brown and not burnt and was served timely.
Only the coffee wasn't up the snuff; I would suggest going across the street for a bold cup.
The joint is family owned and the crowd is what you would expect in this neighborhood (very neighborly).
I am not bashing the Visitacion Valley folk in my 'hood, but this was a very nice place to have breakfast on a warm Sunday morning.
It's family friendly, too.
I will be back.
potatoes.author: Tony L.
potatoes.review: For an unseasonably beautiful November morning here in San Francisco, it was time to dine al fresco for Sunday breakfast.  My dad thinks it's the "Earthquake Weather," but who's checking.  I drove up Cortland Ave. in Bernal Heights and used my parking karma on a spot near St. Kevin's Church.  How lucky!  The place is full of locals, families, some out of towners...good vibe.  The eggs benedict was perfect and the hollandaise sauce wasn't runny.  The potatoes were brown and not burnt and was served timely.  Only the coffee wasn't up the snuff; I would suggest going across the street for a bold cup.  The joint is family owned and the crowd is what you would expect in this neighborhood (very neighborly).  I am not bashing the Visitacion Valley folk in my 'hood, but this was a very nice place to have breakfast on a warm Sunday morning.  It's family friendly, too. I will be back.

excerpts: Today, I discovered that the Eggs Benedict does not come with toast--never mind the fact that it is on the menu immediately above the words "all breakfasts above are served with potatoes and toast.
I first mentioned this to the guy that had place my plate on the counter, but he told m that the Eggs Benedict doesn't come with toast.
Manager / owner guy was at the counter, and I asked him why it doesn't come with toast when, according to the menu, it clearly does.
He said that the biscuits that are part of the Eggs Benedict counted as toast.
What?
I told him that I disagreed
and I felt like I was owed some toast.
He asked me what kind of toast I wanted, I told him rye.
Then, when the toast came he attempted to charge me $1.75 for the toast.
potatoes.author: David L.
potatoes.review:
I've eaten here a few times.  The place has fairly good breakfast, it's a bit over priced, but was willing to forgo that because it is so close to my house.  

Today, I discovered that the Eggs Benedict does not come with toast--never mind the fact that it is on the menu immediately above the words "all breakfasts above are served with potatoes and toast."  I first mentioned this to the guy that had place my plate on the counter, but he told m that the Eggs Benedict doesn't come with toast.  Manager / owner guy was at the counter, and I asked him why it doesn't come with toast when, according to the menu, it clearly does.   He said that the biscuits that are part of the Eggs Benedict counted as toast.  What?  I told him that I disagreed and I felt like I was owed some toast.  He asked me what kind of toast I wanted, I told him rye.  Then, when the toast came he attempted to charge me $1.75 for the toast.   I refused on principal.

I'm not going to cry over toast, but I am going to complain at the manager guy's terrible customer service.  For the two cents the toast cost him and a menu that was corrected the next time I ate there, he could have earned a loyal customer.  Instead, he earned this review and has lost a customer.

excerpts: the salad and potatoes that came along with were a little sub par.
i had to run to martha bros for coffee and then noticed a sign that said "absolutely no outside food or drink".
this could only mean that their coffee sucks and it was a standard thing to go across the street for something better!
i got a few stink eyes for bringing it in anyway...
potatoes.author: Robert S.
potatoes.review: decent tasting chicken pesto crepe.  the salad and potatoes that came along with were a little sub par.  i had to run to martha bros for coffee and then noticed a sign that said "absolutely no outside food or drink".  this could only mean that their coffee sucks and it was a standard thing to go across the street for something better!  i got a few stink eyes for bringing it in anyway...

excerpts: It's  two poached eggs with avocado spread on an english muffin (they need to drain the water out, because the english muffin was a mushy mess),
but it was otherwise quite delicious.
english muffin.author: Fannie S.
english muffin.review:
Freshly squeezed OJ in frosty mugs? Yes, please!  I wanted to order more! 

I had their healthy start breakfast, which looked real good on the counter (waiting to be served.)  It's  two poached eggs with avocado spread on an english muffin (they need to drain the water out, because the english muffin was a mushy mess), but it was otherwise quite delicious.  I ordered a side of sausage, which was good too.  

Prices = reasonable.

Service = friendly. Order at the counter, grab a number and table, and wait for them to bring everything.  

I'll be back here when I'm in the area.

excerpts: It consisted of two poached eggs on an english muffin.
A delicious, fresh made salsa was sprinkled on top of the poached eggs.
It also came with a small salad.
The dish tasted light and flavorful.
english muffin.author: Margaret R.
english muffin.review:
I got the healthy starter. MMmmmmm... It consisted of two poached eggs on an english muffin. A delicious, fresh made salsa was sprinkled on top of the poached eggs. It also came with a small salad. The dish tasted light and flavorful. I would have liked more salsa! 

I also tried the smoked salmon crepe. It tasted a bit too fishy for me, but it still had a nice flavor to it. The hash potatoes were yumz.

The hot apple cider was ehh...Just something similar to the mix you get at the store.

excerpts: We all had the healthy start:  two poached eggs served over a toasted english muffin topped with avocado and fresh salsa.
served with a side salad.
Really tasty and satisfying.
I don't usually make the trek out to Bernal, but this was fun.
Lost a star for having a pretty dingy interior.
english muffin.author: Eliza D.
english muffin.review: This place reminds me a lot of Crepevine. Standard breakfasty/brunch food. We all had the healthy start:  two poached eggs served over a toasted english muffin topped with avocado and fresh salsa. served with a side salad. Really tasty and satisfying. I don't usually make the trek out to Bernal, but this was fun. Lost a star for having a pretty dingy interior.

excerpts: I had a scramble with chicken apple sausage, onions, peppers and tomato.
It was pretty good, but I could have done better at home.
chicken apple sausage.author: Michael M.
chicken apple sausage.review:
In my continuing quest of my new neighborhood, I decided to trek up the hill a bit and hit this cafe.

The service couldn't be better.  Order at the counter, make sure you get a big mug of coffee, and have a seat.  You will wait longer for your food than most places, but that's OK ... everybody seems to just want to relax. A bit pricier than I expected.

I had a scramble with chicken apple sausage, onions, peppers and tomato.  It was pretty good, but I could have done better at home.  The potatoes are OK, but would be better with some spice or veggies thrown in.

Other items on the menu include omelets, bagels, breakfast sandwiches, pancakes, etc.  The coffee was good and better than Martha Brothers and Progressive Grounds.

It was a good, family oriented place where everybody seems to know everybody else ... just what you would expect to find in a neighborhood dive.  I'll be back now and then to try other things.

excerpts: The prices seem fairly steep for just a bagel with cream cheese, cheeseburgers are a tad overpriced and just to add bacon is like an extra $4.
However, we went with it because my sister normally does not let us down when it comes to dining.
My grandmother and aunt, each ordered separately and my mom and I ordered together.

My mom and sister already knew what they wanted,  (2 cheeseburgers at 10.95 each with a side of fries), my mom placed her order with a bald gentleman that seemed to be the owner, while I stood there trying to decide.
Immediately he grew impatient and I could feel his negative energy, so I rushed to judgement and ordered a cheeseburger as well.
We asked for 2 canned sodas at $1.25 each and when he rang up the total, it came to $56.95.
Hmmm.
My mom questioned, "$57?," to which the owner replied, "We use good quality food."
My mom is fairly passive and just paid.
I, on the other hand a total penny pincher, thought about it while I washed my hands in the restroom, and came back out and told my mom that didn't seem right.
3 cheeseburgers @ 10.95
each equals 32.85 + 2 sodas @ 1.25 adds up to 35.35.
That would be almost $20 in tax
I know San Francisco is expensive,
but no way.
My mom agreed and so her
and I walked up to the counter and very kindly explained to the owner that it didn't add up.
He immediately got testy but looked at the receipt roll in the register and kept repeating that it's expensive because of the quality.
That still doesn't explain a $20 difference.
I kindly told him, that I think he might of misheard our order and with the quickness, his temper went from zero to a hundred.
He yelled and pointed at me, "YOU ARE BEING RUDE
AND I HAVE THE RIGHT
TO REFUSE SERVICE!
YOU NEED TO LEAVE
RIGHT NOW!"
And before you knew it, he was throwing money at my mother.
He continued to yell repeatedly, "I HAVE THE RIGHT
TO REFUSE SERVICE
, I HAVE THE RIGHT
TO REFUSE SERVICE
, I HAVE THE RIGHT
TO REFUSE SERVICE.
This whole time, my 85 year old grandmother was fixing her cup of joe next to us, didn't hear a thing (she has a hearing aid,
but of course her hearing isn't totally reliable) and we had to tell her we needed to leave.
So he threw money at her, my great aunt and proceeded to kick us out of his cafe.

Im amazed at how quickly his attitude changed when he didn't like being questioned and the fact that he would have such little respect or class to throw out 4 women, including my 85 year old grandmother!!!
Regardless of the quality excuse, I think this guy was trying to take us for a ride and possibly thought that we were dumb enough to fall for it and not do the math.
I will never go here again, my family will never go here again, and my sister has advice her city friends not to go there ever again.
Rude, impolite, ridiculous and a skeez.
If you ever wanted to visit the infamous Soup Nazi, go see this guy.
Seriously.
bagel with cream cheese.author: Jodi C.
bagel with cream cheese.review:
Just this last Wednesday, my mom, my great aunt and my grandmother drove up to San Francisco to visit my sister who has resided in the city for about 24 years.   My sister normally doesnt each lunch and didn't really know where to take us, but lives in this neighborhood and had heard good things about this place.  She is a very busy person and had to just drop us off and take care of some quick business.   Looking at the menu, all of us were feeling a lil unsure of what to order.  The prices seem fairly steep for just a bagel with cream cheese, cheeseburgers are a tad overpriced and just to add bacon is like an extra $4.  However, we went with it because my sister normally does not let us down when it comes to dining.  My grandmother and aunt, each ordered separately and my mom and I ordered together.  My mom and sister already knew what they wanted,  (2 cheeseburgers at 10.95 each with a side of fries), my mom placed her order with a bald gentleman that seemed to be the owner, while I stood there trying to decide.   Immediately he grew impatient and I could feel his negative energy, so I rushed to judgement and ordered a cheeseburger as well.  We asked for 2 canned sodas at $1.25 each and when he rang up the total, it came to $56.95.  Hmmm.  My mom questioned, "$57?," to which the owner replied, "We use good quality food."  My mom is fairly passive and just paid.   I, on the other hand a total penny pincher, thought about it while I washed my hands in the restroom, and came back out and told my mom that didn't seem right.  3 cheeseburgers @ 10.95 each equals 32.85 + 2 sodas @ 1.25 adds up to 35.35.  That would be almost $20 in tax.....hmmmm....I know San Francisco is expensive, but no way.  My mom agreed and so her and I walked up to the counter and very kindly explained to the owner that it didn't add up.  He immediately got testy but looked at the receipt roll in the register and kept repeating that it's expensive because of the quality.  That still doesn't explain a $20 difference.  I kindly told him, that I think he might of misheard our order and with the quickness, his temper went from zero to a hundred.  He yelled and pointed at me, "YOU ARE BEING RUDE AND I HAVE THE RIGHT TO REFUSE SERVICE! YOU NEED TO LEAVE RIGHT NOW!"  And before you knew it, he was throwing money at my mother.  He continued to yell repeatedly, "I HAVE THE RIGHT TO REFUSE SERVICE, I HAVE THE RIGHT TO REFUSE SERVICE, I HAVE THE RIGHT TO REFUSE SERVICE."
This whole time, my 85 year old grandmother was fixing her cup of joe next to us, didn't hear a thing (she has a hearing aid, but of course her hearing isn't totally reliable) and we had to tell her we needed to leave.  So he threw money at her, my great aunt and proceeded to kick us out of his cafe. 
Im amazed at how quickly his attitude changed when he didn't like being questioned and the fact that he would have such little respect or class to throw out 4 women, including my 85 year old grandmother!!!  Regardless of the quality excuse, I think this guy was trying to take us for a ride and possibly thought that we were dumb enough to fall for it and not do the math.  
I will never go here again, my family will never go here again, and my sister has advice her city friends not to go there ever again.  
Rude, impolite, ridiculous and a skeez. 
If you ever wanted to visit the infamous Soup Nazi, go see this guy.  Seriously.

excerpts: Once we ordered a bagel with cream cheese, it came out toasted and my daughter was upset.
They quickly offered to make another one free of charge (I was willing to pay) and told us to keep the other one for the rest of us.
One star off as some items definitely seem to be a little overpriced, but others seem to be a good deal.
bagel with cream cheese.author: Kim K.
bagel with cream cheese.review: It is one of our families absolute favorites.  Yummy food and great service.  They have always been so nice to us.  My daughter is a bit of a fussy eater and they have always tried to help us.  Once we ordered a bagel with cream cheese, it came out toasted and my daughter was upset.  They quickly offered to make another one free of charge (I was willing to pay) and told us to keep the other one for the rest of us.  One star off as some items definitely seem to be a little overpriced, but others seem to be a good deal.

excerpts: I love the toasted bagel with cream cheese, sun dried tomatos and cucumbers.
and they're crapes are good too.
Everything made to order and they're coffee
is good, too.
bagel with cream cheese.author: Kelly Marie C.
bagel with cream cheese.review: They're breakfast food is great! I love the toasted bagel with cream cheese, sun dried tomatos and cucumbers. and they're crapes are good too. Everything made to order and they're coffee is good, too.

excerpts: They offers salads, vegetarian friendly dishes, crepes (savory or sweet), scrambles, omelettes, sandwiches, burgers, bagels, sides (their house potatoes are my favorite), breakfast combos, coffees, teas, juices, smoothies, you name it.
Restroom for customers is always clean.
Fun music playing throughout the day.
There is plenty of seating inside or if you'd like you can sit outside and take in the fresh air.
I love bringing my family and friends here when they visit me.
They always leave happy and full.
Highly recommend this place!
juices.author: Cristal F.
juices.review: Amazing cafe in the Bernal Heights neighborhood. I love coming here because the service is great and food always comes out fast and delicious. They have an extensive menu. They offers salads, vegetarian friendly dishes, crepes (savory or sweet), scrambles, omelettes, sandwiches, burgers, bagels, sides (their house potatoes are my favorite), breakfast combos, coffees, teas, juices, smoothies, you name it. Restroom for customers is always clean. Fun music playing throughout the day. There is plenty of seating inside or if you'd like you can sit outside and take in the fresh air. I love bringing my family and friends here when they visit me. They always leave happy and full. Highly recommend this place!

excerpts: I love their crepes, blintzes, croissant breakfast sandwiches, and of course their juices.
May they never go away!
juices.author: Stella T.
juices.review: I love this cafe, and when I visit Bernal, this is where I go for breakfast after a jaunt over to Martha's for my chai latte with 2 shots of espresso! I found that they will actually fill a 2 quart container with their fresh squeezed oj or orange carrot juice which I LOVE at my request. It's SO delicious. I will always come here. I love their crepes, blintzes, croissant breakfast sandwiches, and of course their juices. May they never go away!

excerpts: The juices are freshly squeezed.
Yes, they have carrot and orange juice.
Both are great.
juices.author: Yina M.
juices.review: Moonlight cafe has changed over the years! I really enjoy going there now. The food is very fresh and well made. The juices are freshly squeezed. Yes, they have carrot and orange juice. Both are great. I've their healthy start on the memo. Their bacon is that the kind with thick cut. I like to go there on the weekend with my dog. Wish they have outdoor heater though, because you know it could be kinda chilly in bernal sometime. :)

excerpts: If you ever happen to be walking along Cortland, famished around 3:00pm, you're pretty much out of luck unless you settle for pastries or little snacks.
Except for one saving grace ...
pastries.author: F. P.
pastries.review:
If you ever happen to be walking along Cortland, famished around 3:00pm, you're pretty much out of luck unless you settle for pastries or little snacks.  Except for one saving grace ... Moonlight Cafe.

At first glance, it looks like a little coffeeshop with probably not much in the way of hearty grub.  But as soon as you walk in, you get a whiff of eggs and sausages and notice the meticulously handwritten (and colorful) menu (a la Crepevine) and you know you're going to be just fine.

They have the usual (omelets, scrambles, crepes, burgers) and your not so usual (Mediterranean platter, several beer options).

I had the Mediterranean omelet with feta, artichoke and olives.  Very filling and served with some home fries.  Totally hit the spot.
